Entries.default: The closer you near to the dimly lit essence that smolders over the Rathun's burnt corpse, the stronger you feel the soul's flickering confusion and grief.
[Reach for the soul.]
[Leave it be.]
Rather than falling face-forward into a vision of the Rathun's final memory, her last thoughts scream through your mind in a jumble of disjointed words - and disbelief.

<ispeech>I am burning I am burning I am burning, and it is not in pleasure, not for Mother Magran; I should have listened when she said NOTHING, but I was willing to die to reach the ever-flame, to sacrifice them and everything to ash, to vanquish the defiler; and I am burning but not in the flame, not with honor and eternity. But for a moment -

I am disgraced.</ispeech>
[Dig deeper into her final memory.]
[Pull back from the memory.]

<ispeech>Who? Who will lay the torc before the Mother to fire the way? Who is left? Who will guard the sacred spire - the Mother's mind? Who will descend the shrine to the defilers' god's face?

Not these hands that are ashes sifting on a breath that is a last sigh of a wretchedly snuffed life.

Not me and mine. Now she who was blackened and befouled and forsaken by the flames. Forsaken... by Magran?!</ispeech>
With a final flicker, a last swift and violent shuddering, the soul dims... and disintegrates.
The soul shudders atop the priestess' remains before settling, half suffused into her charred skin.
The corpse lies desolate and black, bereft of soul essence.

<ispeech>Who? Who will lay the torc before the Mother to fire the way? Who is left? Who will guard the sacred spire - the Mother's mind? Who will descend the shrine to the defilers' god's face?

Not these hands that are ashes sifting on a breath that is a last sigh of a wretchedly snuffed life.

Not me and mine. Now she who was blackened and befouled and forsaken by the flames. Forsaken... by Magran?!</ispeech>
[Pry the torc from the priestess' hand.]
Twisting the torc free cracks off three of the priestess' blackened, brittle fingers.
The corpse lies desolate and black, bereft of soul essence.
[Pry the torc from the priestess' hand.]
Twisting the torc free cracks off three of the priestess' blackened, brittle fingers.
[Leave it be.]
[Leave it be.]
The closer you near to the dimly lit essence that smolders over the Rathun's burnt corpse, the stronger you feel the soul's flickering confusion and grief.

"Rest easy now, priestess. I'll harvest your soul and your torment, too." 

Coaxing the soul with a low and soothing voice, Xoti jiggles her lantern over the priestess' charred corpse. There's not much left after the trauma the soul endured, but a few glimmering motes whorl around the soft light before fading into the lantern.
Ashen, crooked fingers clutch a still flaming torc, grasping the relic tightly even in death.
Ashen, crooked fingers clutch a still flaming torc, grasping the relic tightly even in death.
